text: [Music]
hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with Valentine's carpaccio that's
right a meat heart for your sweetheart
so I've received many food wishes for
carpaccio so I figured what a great time
to show it all right so we're going to
start with some beef tenderloin filet of
beef fully trimmed absolutely no silver
skin no visible fat on the outside okay
besides the beef you're going to want a
very sharp knife and what we're going to
do is we're going to slice across the
grain into thin slices now you don't
need to make them paper-thin here
because we're going to pound this so
just try to get nice even slices you
could just see how gorgeous that beef is
you're going to want to go to a very
reputable butcher and get a very very
high quality piece of beef because we're
going to eat this raw so we want to mess
around don't be buying a that meat from
the guy named Tony that sells it out of
the trunk of his Camaro this is not the
recipe to save a few bucks alright once
our beef is sliced I'm going to take a
spray bottle and put a little bit of
water down on the cutting board then I'm
going to lay a piece of plastic over and
the water's gonna help that stick and
keep it very steady then I'm going to
take my slices of beef and form a heart
shape now it does not have to be perfect
because we're really going to shape this
on the plate but you want to get it
close it's definitely okay to overlap
the meat a little bit we're going to
pound this and don't do too much all
right carpaccio you want a very small
portion this is only going to be maybe
two ounces of beef so if you put too
much on here by the time you pound it
thin it's going to be bigger than your
plate so be careful with the portion I'm
going to go ahead and lay another piece
of plastic over that I'm going to take
my meat pounder and gently give the old
tap a tappa and we want it all the same
thickness and we want it about an eighth
of an inch thick so I'm just going to
keep going around and around until it's
all uniform all right at that point
we're going to go ahead and peel off the
top layer of plastic and what we're
going to do is we're going to try to
flip this over onto a plate without
messing it up okay
so peel off the plastic put your hand
underneath and just plop it down on a
plate meat side down of course peel off
the plastic and then we're just going to
go around with our fingertips and help
shape it into a more perfect heart
we had it pretty close but we are going
to go around and just make it a little
more perfect now once you have what you
think is a very nice heart shape put a
piece of plastic over the top take your
meat pounder again and this time we're
just going to give it a little press all
right we don't want to wreck our shape
and I don't really want to flatten it
out anymore but I just want the surface
to be nice and smooth you see that
that's going to make it look very cool
when we serve this and that's ready so
you can prep that part ahead of time
those consider in the refrigerator for
hours waiting for your romantic dinner
alright so I'm gonna throw that in the
fridge until needed when I am ready to
serve I'm going to need what's called a
Citra net we've made these before so I'm
just going to do some lemon juice a
little Dijon and some extra-virgin olive
oil not too much I think this dressing
should be very tart so I have just about
equal portions of lemon juice and oil
we're gonna season this up with a little
bit of salt pepper cayenne all right I'm
gonna take a whisk and emulsify that by
the way you drizzle oil in people when
you have mustard in a dressing you can
skip that step you can mix everything
together because there's something in
the mustard less that then I believe
that actually helps emulsify this so
just whisk it up you're gonna have a
beautiful dressing and there we go all
right so I'm going to set that aside and
then the last step here is a little
arugula salad to garnish capers and then
some shaved parmesan the real stuff of
course alright these little bitter
greens are very traditional with
carpaccio you want something very
bracing as far as a garnish to match
that buttery soft raw beef or I'm going
to drizzle in a little bit of the
dressing just to moisten that this is
optional you can just dress the entire
plate at the end but I like to do a
little bit on the salad first
and by the way should you find out ahead
of time if your Valentine is willing to
eat raw meat before you plan this menu
probably not a bad idea but hopefully
they're down with that for final
assembly peel your plastic off put a
little pile of your arugula salad in the
center I'm probably going to shave a
little more parmesan over the top we're
going to season with freshly ground
black pepper and definitely a very
generous sprinkling of sea salt or
kosher salt you want something that has
a flake all right that has a nice big
crystal you want to see the salt and
then last but not least we're going to
drizzle on a little
or the dressing and there you go
Valentine's carpaccio a meat heart for
your sweetheart I will never get tired
of saying that
so not only is this a clever and very
gorgeous Valentine's first course it's
delicious that unbelievably tender

from the parmesan
that's it Renaud just a great great
